bibl.title: Letter fragment from [s.n.] to [Howard A. Kelly?], December 13, 1906

div1.p: Convening of Medical Legislative Council delayed; unable to meet recipient [letter incomplete].

div1.head: Letter fragment from [s.n.] to [Howard A. Kelly?], December 13, 1906
div1.opener:
EUROPEAN PLAN
CABLE ADDRESS “NEWWILLARD”
THE NEWWILLARD,
PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE, FOURTEENTH AND F STREETS.
WASHINGTON, D.C. Dec. 13" 1906
F.S. HIGHT, MANAGER
My Dear Doctor
div1.p:
The exact date of convening the
Med. Leg. Council was postponed so long
it became impossible to arrange my
plans -- hence I only arrived in Washing-
ton this morning -- and will of necessity be
compelled to forego the anticipated pleasure of
seeing you -- & your operative skill -- and
more. Engagements (professional) which I cannot break
make it imperative that I be home the last
of next week -- and a business us in New York
Calls me to that City Monday or Tuesday night
